just had a fish mcwrap for the 1st time. long wrap, little fish and some pathetic shreds of salad. they try to mask the bland taste of the fish with overly sweet chilli/ketchup. btw, salad and sweet chilli/ketchup don't exactly go well together. i don't think this is eating well at all. it was awful. for the price i paid, i could have had a decent meal elsewhere. what was i thinking?! as a consolation, i've always loved the himalayan tea. milky, sweet, cinnamony...

Wow luckily I didn't buy but I bought nacho fillet instead but looks like they are rushing to prepare because the fillet is slanted and when I tried to shift it the cheese sticks so hard to the bun so I can't moved it means the fillet burger was prepared for quite some time and the lettuce is everywhere ....

3.post_text:
Enjoy our new Fish McWrap® with a refreshing glass of Coca-Cola® Light (S) at an introductory price of $5.50*. 
Featuring quality white fish from Alaska and crunchy vegetables, drizzled with spicy sweet chilli sauce, and wrapped in a wholegrain tortilla, the Fish McWrap is oh-so-delicious, yet 99% guilt-free! Find out more at http://goo.gl/eIJ5jE

*Introductory price available for a limited time only. Not available during breakfast hours, on McDelivery®, at iFly Singapore, Resorts World Sentosa and institutional stores.

comments.message: Last time used to be $2, then increased to $2.50. Now increase to $3, but few more variety to choose. But still I wished it stayed at $2 for a sausage muffin & a cuppa coffee.
When is the curry sauce coming back in stock! No curry, still promo. What's the point?

I don't think you guys take feedback seriously. I wrote in to the customer care and i got a standard reply (out of a standard script) and when i replied to that, i get another standard reply. The fact is my issue never got address. I wrote in to complain that there were a few occasion when i went to the McDonald's KK Hospital and was given an 'old' toy instead of the current promotion on the pretext that there are no stock. When i asked to see the manager, suddenly they seem to have stock of the current promotion. Which gives rise to me suspecting that the KK Hospital outlet seem to be the dumping ground for old stock at the expense of sick children. The reply i got is that "toys from previous series will be offered to customers in the event that the current promotional toy has been fully redeemed". I wrote back to mention that my issue was not address as the 'stock appeared' when i ask to see the manager and the reply i got was "a standard specific number of toys for Happy meals are distributed to our stores islandwide. They are redeemed on a while stocks lasts basis." So again, how did the stock appear when i ask to see the manager?? I would like to further clarify, it not the stock of the previous series but it seems like the stock of some few months ago was what i had..the case in particular that i was talking about was the Shaun the Sheep series. I have actually wanted to write earlier but forgot about it until i say a picture of my son wearing the Shaun the sheep spectacles that reminded me that i should write in. I did write in but if McDonald's cannot properly address this, i shall share here and see if others have the same experiences.
All u ppl complaint for what just stop buying and support the local shops

7.post_text:
Hi all, we've been alerted to an online promotion which appears to offer McDonald's vouchers as prizes. 

We would like to alert all customers that this offer does not originate from McDonald's Singapore and is not authorised by McDonald’s Singapore.

We urge all customers to refer to the Promotions tab on our corporate website www.mcdonalds.com.sg or our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/mcdsg for information on genuine promotions and offers. Thank you.

9.post_text:
Dear customers, we will be performing scheduled maintenance for our McDelivery system and will not be able to accept McDelivery orders during these periods:

- 0300 to 0400 hours on 1 April 2015, across all ordering platforms.
- 0400 to 0600 hours on 1 April 2015, across McDelivery website and mobile ordering app. Customers can place their orders via McDelivery hotline at 6777 3777 during this time.

We apologise for any inconvenience caused and we appreciate your patience as we work to serve you better.

17.post_text:
Created in February 1962 by Lou Groen, the Filet-O-Fish® has gone on to become one of our all-time classics.

But did you know that our recipe has remained almost unchanged for 53 years? It’s still and always will be your favourite fish patty, tangy tartar sauce and half a slice of cheese (yes, it has always been half a slice!) in a steamed bun.

Truly a time-honoured burger! Find out more at http://goo.gl/SC9OnG

19.post_text:
You don’t have to go far to find Singapore’s newest island! Introducing Thousand Island Filet-O-Fish®, the classic with a twist.

Made with quality white fish, our famous patty now comes topped with a lip-smacking thousand island sauce. Dive into the Thousand Island Filet-O-Fish® Extra Value Meal™ and discover a thousand reasons to smile, at just $5 in-stores! Find out more at https://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/promotions/2dollarfiletofish/.

21.post_text:
Today, we'd like to congratulate Stephen Tan, Lee Teng Yi, Janette Tan, Yeo Sze Min and Goh Yee Ping, for each winning a breakfast treat for their amazing parents. Here's Stephen's super mum and her wonderful family. The feisty 85-year-old has raised 15 children, helped take care of 30 grandchildren, and now she helps to look after two great grandchildren! 

A big thank you to everyone who joined our National Breakfast Day Instagram contest! We received many heart-warming entries, and would like to thank you for joining us as we show appreciation for our super mums and super dads. 

This isn't the end of our National Breakfast Day celebrations! We'll be giving away over 120,000 Egg McMuffins in restaurants islandwide on 9 March, so be sure to join us then. For more information, and terms and conditions, visit https://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/promotions/national-breakfast/.

22.post_text:
Did you know? When you order a $5 Filet-O-Fish® Extra Value Meal, you’re saving more than just money!

As part of our commitment to help protect marine resources, McDonald’s works with sustainable fisheries to source quality white fish from Alaska for the Filet-O-Fish®.

Enjoy its great taste, while doing good at the same time. Now that’s true value!

comments.message: Singaporeans are so funny. Give free also they complain. Never give free also they complain. They're already doing a good deed by giving out the free muffins. I dont see any other fastfood outlet doing such a thing, thus for tis, you guys shld respect mcdonald's management.

People who complain that McDonald's isn't giving to schools/homeless people instead should think again.

McDonald's is a private company that puts its profits first. Any company will do that too. And what makes you think McDonald's never give back to society?

What about our government, do you see them giving 120,000 McMuffins for free? No! Instead they use our taxpayers money to pay for their ridiculously high salaries and even say NSFs & NSMen shouldn't be recognized for their service with cash.

Those who kept saying about giving to the unfortunate. Why don't all of you get the burgers on their behalf and give it to them personally since it sounds like you know where they are. 

I'm grateful enough that by doing this, they are already helping a lot of low income ppl and students who would come and have the burger just to save money instead of spending it for breakfast or lunch.

And McDonald has always been helping the beneficiaries with their own donations and charities.

And this is why Singapore will always be "unhappy" .

24.post_text:
This National Breakfast Day, we are expressing our gratitude to some amazing mums and dads in our community, with breakfast deliveries on us!
 
Today, we want to congratulate Stacy Chew, Mascarenhas Terry Jude, Evelyn Kuah, Mrs.Mathivanan Isaiamuthu, Ketty Lim, and Lim Aik Fan, for winning our National Breakfast Day Instagram Contest! Each of them has won a breakfast treat for their amazing parent.
 
Here’s Stacy’s mum, who chose to give up her career to be home to raise four daughters. Despite all the hard work and testing times, Stacy’s mum never complained – a super mum indeed!
 
5 more breakfast giveaways are up for grabs, so keep those entries coming!

To enter:
1. Share a picture of your amazing Mum or Dad on Instagram. In your caption, tell us how and why your nominee is a Super Mum or Super Dad and why they deserve breakfast on us. Remember to hashtag your entry with #MCDBreakfastDay and #MCDBreakfastDaySG.
 
2. Send us a private message on Facebook with your full name, Instagram username and email address*
 
Contest closes on 6 March, 12 midnight.
 
The last batch of winners will be announced on 7 March.
 
For contest terms and conditions, visit https://mcdonalds.com.sg/promotions/McDNBDSMSD.
 
*Information requested will be used to contact winners
